question: (This is an excellent forum.  THANK YOU Dr. Lupo!!)My husband & I have unexplained infertility, both of us in excellent health except for my hypothyroidism/Hashimoto's (TSH was at 6.0 two years ago, now down to 2.47, working on getting it a little lower).  I ovulate just fine every month, his sperm count/motility are good.  But my thyroid Antibodies are through the roof - 1000.I know western medicine says there's little we can do about Hashimoto's (other than keep the TSH in the right range and keep an eye on things, and maybe try some baby aspirin), but is there any evidence of any success with "alternative/complimentary" treatments, such as acupuncture??Also, does Dr. Lupo have any strong opinions on Synthroid versus Armour (bioidentical from pig thyroids)??  I know Dr. Steven Hotze in Houston (who's well known for thyroid work) believes strongly in Armour.Thanks! - Jessica sqrrrlgrrrl
title: Alternative Therapy for Hashimotos?
